newsitem.title: Israel: Two killed, 4 wounded in Israeli bus attack.
newsitem.headline: Two killed, 4 wounded in Israeli bus attack.

text.p: Two schoolgirls were killed and at least four people were wounded when a Jordanian solider fired on an Israeli school bus at the Israeli-Jordanian border on Thursday, rescuers said.
Israeli radio stations said the soldier shot at a bus along the border in a farm area which Israel leases from Jordan under a 1994 peace deal. Other Jordanian soldiers overpowered the gunman.
Israelis and Palestinians had feared an outbreak of violence following Israel's decision to forge ahead with a Jewish settlement in Arab East Jerusalem.
A hospital in the area was preparing for as many as 20 or more wounded. Several teenage schoolgirls arrived by ambulance. Some wounded were reported taken to hospital in Jordan.
"According to information that is in our hands, there are two dead...Details are unclear for now," Israel radio said.
A witness told Army radio: "We arrived at the area swiftly. A group of schoolgirls who were on the 'Island of Peace'...They tried to get away from there because he didn't let them clear the wounded."
Another witness said: "There is a huge great panic. Many, many security forces have arrived." Helicopters hovered overhead.
"By all appearances we are talking about a bus, a bus of children, which was fired upon by a Jordanian soldier from the border at the Naharayim junction," the witness told Israel Radio.
Jordan and Israel signed a treaty in October 1994 and their border has been quiet for years.
